metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3620 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in Ansible Engine's ansible-connection module, where sensitive information such as the Ansible user credentials is disclosed by default in the traceback error message. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3620` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible-core - 2.12.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ansible package in kinetic is affected and needs fixing.
ansible-core package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.12.0-1').
